Articles.Content:
So I installed several mods, and dropped the files that were in the 'GameData' files of the mods into the 'GameData' file on ksp.

My understanding is that doing this alone is enough for the mods to activate. Unfortunately, this doesn't seem to work ever since the release of 1.1 (and yes, I made sure I use the mods compatible with 1.1).

Is there any way to manually activate them?

And you copied the files into the gamedata folder of the 1.1 installation and not into any backup folder?

Where is that 1.1 folder? The absolute path. If it is in a subfolder of C:\program files or C:\program files (x86) then Windows will prevent any foreign executable code from being called by KSP.

A screenshot of your gamedata folder might also give us some clues.

10 hours ago, Harry Rhodan said:

 

Where is that 1.1 folder? The absolute path. If it is in a subfolder of C:\program files or C:\program files (x86) then Windows will prevent any foreign executable code from being called by KSP.

 

This is not true. At least not for everyone. All my mods work just fine and KSP is loaded under Program Files (x86).

This is what my GameData folder looks like. The mods are all there, but none of them work!

 

 

 

Edited April 7, 2016 by upsilone

12 hours ago, ExplorerKlatt said:

This is not true. At least not for everyone.

Not for everyone but for some people.

6 hours ago, upsilone said:

This is what my GameData folder looks like. The mods are all there, but none of them work!

Now what happens if you copy the whole game to somewhere outside Program Files (x86) like C:\Games and try to manually launch that copy?

And you can delete that PlanetShine-0.2.5 folder.

I deleted PlanetShine-0.2.5, but the same issue happens when I copy the whole folder and paste it somewhere else.

None of my mods work. It's as if something is stopping them from activating (and I checked my anti-virus, it's not that either).
I don't see Module Manger. When you load up KSP do you see "Module Manger XXX Patches applied"? And if you do does it say "XXX Patches applied found X errors in XFile location"?
